note.p: Career: Tutor to Lord Algernon Percy, second son of the Duke of Northumberland, in Edinburgh; ordained; evening preacher, City of London Lying-in Hospital; Lecturer, Old Church and New Church, Deptford; Rector of North Chapel, Sussex; founded the Kent Dispensary (later the Miller Hospital, Greenwich) (1783); worked to promote, and several times preached the anniversary sermon for, the Royal Humane Society; preached at the Grand Lodge of Freemasons and at the Maidstone Assizes
Notes: Note on certificate: 'Ballotted for & rejected May 20 1779'
